intro: Ecbolium squarrosum, commonly known as the rough ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, bristly stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
